content.description:
Layback up the left facing corner to its top. Move right as the crack curves over that way. Then head up onto the arete and the top. 

  Great rock and a very cool feature.
content.location: Walking along the valley around the second pair of boulders. If you look up the hillside you will see a pretty big slab, maybe 25 feet wide with a large dead tree leaning against it. This boulder is about 100 feet up the hill. The problem climbs a left facing corner on the right hand face of this boulder.

content.description: Sit start on crimps, climb out and up the right arete. Follow it up and left to the highest point on the steep face. Don't forget to commit to the top out ;)
content.location: Up the hill aprox. 300ft from the "Unknown V3" on what I'm calling the swoosh boulder

content.description:
This is the slope between the valley and the right side of the rim. There are loads of boulders on the hillside, so many that finding your way back to the same one twice can be difficult without some hunting. 

  As with most areas some of the rock is amazing, in cases too good, no holds. In other places the rock is a load of choss. 

  This hillside catches a lot of sun and is less sheltered from the wind than down in the Valley or Gully.
